sentences.sContent: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.
sentences.sCn: 通过科学我们已有了将进步与未来联系起来的观念。

sentences.sContent: ...associate director of the Council of Better Business Bureau...
...associate professor of classics at Reed College in Portland...
...an associate professor at Penn’s Wharton School...
...They don't like to associate technology with food...
...associate professor at New York Law School...
...using a computer-based test that measures how quickly people associate positive and negative words—such as "love" or "evil"—with photos of black or white faces...
...A similar test can also measure how quickly subjects associate stereotypical traits—such as athletic skills or mental ability—with a particular group...
...they also showed that those with the lowest bias were likely to subconsciously associate black skin colour with political words such as "government" or "president"...
...isn't the first to associate greenery with better health...

synos.tran: 联想；使联合；使发生联系

phrases.pCn: v. 联合；与…联系在一起；和…来往
n. 美国大学修满二年课程的肄业证书
副主任，副总监；副董事；联席董事；副导演
副学士（修满两年大学课程）

remMethod.val: as(表加强) ＋ soci(同伴， 结交) ＋ ate → 交往 参考： associate professor 副教授

words.tran: 协会，联盟，社团；联合；联想
为准会员；准社员的职位
联想心理学；观念联合论

trans.tranCn: 把…联系在一起；使联合，结合；交往	[ə'səuʃiət]
trans.tranOther: to make a connection in your mind between one thing or person and another
someone who is a member etc of something, but who is at a lower level and has fewer rights
someone who you work or do business with
